timeline.message: Adding rest of schema evolution tests
Added struct tests and improved new doc

timeline.bodyText: Is this class just a convenience to override the conf values?
timeline.author: massdosage
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,53 @@

+package com.hotels.bdp.circustrain.integration.utils;
+
+import org.apache.hadoop.hive.conf.HiveConf;
+import org.apache.hadoop.hive.conf.HiveConf.ConfVars;
+
+import com.hotels.beeju.ThriftHiveMetaStoreJUnitRule;
+
+public class ThriftMetastoreServerRuleExtension extends ThriftHiveMetaStoreJUnitRule {

replies.bodyText: Pretty much yep, beforeTest() is called from within beeju, so this is where we will initialise beeju with the hiverunner metastore
replies.author: max-jacobs

replies.bodyText: We should push this to Beeju once and fix it there (We also do this in other internal projects).
replies.author: patduin

replies.bodyText: Agreed, can someone do that now? It not can we add an issue over at BeeJU and refer to this?
replies.author: massdosage

timeline.bodyText: So is this the class you're not so sure about adding as it increases the test running time so much? One option could be to use a Junit 4 Category (SchemaTests) and then turn off this category by default when Maven runs the test. Then in the SCHEMA_EVOLUTION.md you could add a section about the tests and show how one can run them on the CLI by telling Maven to specifically run tests with that category. I assume that's the idea here - they're a safety net that we should never need but they could be useful every now and then just to make sure we haven't broken any of the schema evolution rules as we understand them today?
timeline.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText:
Yep this is the one. In total these tests take ~10 mins on my machine. Plus they all pass (when in reality the non supported schema evolutions shouldn't - for those cases I've made the tests expect an exception to be thrown).
They're a safety net, and also useful if a feature is ever added to CT to support some of the currently failing evolutions. They're essentially supporting tests for the added readme as "proof".
replies.author: max-jacobs

replies.bodyText: I've added junit category as suggested, added to the doc too. Let me know what you think, thanks!
replies.author: max-jacobs

timeline.bodyText: We pass this in but then don't use it for anything? Or am I missing something here?
timeline.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: Yep its used in the new integration tests. It seemed easier with Hiverunner to just setup one metastore with a source db and a replica db. So I had to change the runner here to be able to set different dbs. The other integration tests don't use this, so the replicaDatabaseName just defaults to the databaseName if empty.
replies.author: max-jacobs

timeline.author: massdosage

timeline.bodyText: What's the benefit of the try/catch/rethrow over letting this just throw the original exception?
timeline.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: Good point, no benefit, will remove
replies.author: max-jacobs
